info.description:
The AppMon Server exposes management and integration functionality via REST endpoints. This interactive documentation also acts as a REST client you can use to interact with the AppMon Server.

The HTTP status code of the response shows the result of your request. The expected response code for a successful request is documented individually per REST endpoint. Additionally the following error response codes can typically occur in our REST interface:

* **400** - Bad Request: Some request parameters are not correct.
* **401** - Unauthorized: A valid authorization header (Basic Authentication) is required but is not available.
* **403** - Forbidden: Execution of request is not allowed, e.g. the user has no privileges.
* **404** - Not Found: Endpoint does not exist or some entities could not be found, e.g. System Profile.
* **500** - Internal Server Error: See response body for details.

Additional [usage examples](https://www.dynatrace.com/support/doc/appmon71/shortlink/id_server_rest_examples) can be found in the AppMon documentation.
info.title: AppMon Server REST API

get.description: Get a list of all alerts (incidents) that match the filter settings. If no start and end date is specified, a default time frame of three days is selected.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Minimum start date of the alert (ISO8601)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Maximum end date of the alert (ISO8601)

200.description: List of alerts in response body

post.description:
Create an alert (incident) for a System Profile and Incident Rule. The request must contain the alert as JSON representation. If the request does not contain a start and end date, the the current server time will be used. The default severity is 'informational' and the default state is 'Created'. 
Alerts with a severity of 'informational' are automatically set to state 'Confirmed'. You can set such alerts to other states with a subsequent update. 
It is possible to specify the start date and leave the end date unset, the end date can then be provided later with an update. 
At least the JSON properties 'systemprofile' and 'message' have to be specified.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

404.description: Not Found: System Profile or Incident Rule could not be found

get.description: Get the JSON representation of an alert (incident).

200.description: Alert representation in response body

put.description: Several attributes of an alert (incident) can be modified by updating it. You can either retrieve the alert record via the GET call first and then send the modified JSON object, or you could make a partial update by providing only the properties that should get updated. The alert will be implicitly closed by the update with the current server time as end time if no specific end time is provided.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

delete.description: Permanently delete an alert (incident) record.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.description: Get a list of all existing alert suppressions (incident downtimes). The response can optionally be filtered by either a System Profile or a combination of System Profile and Incident rule. The response contains the URL and the name of each alert suppression.

200.description: List of alert suppressions in response body

get.description: Gets the JSON representation of an existing alert suppression (incident downtime).

200.description: Alert suppression representation in response body

put.description:
Create an alert suppression (incident downtime) by sending a JSON representation as the request body. If an alert suppression with the given name already exists, it will be replaced by the newly created alert suppression. 

You can either create a one-time suppression by setting the JSON property 'once' to 'true', or create a repeatedly scheduled suppression by providing either a Quartz cron expression or a reference to business hours defined in the self-monitoring System Profile. Referencing business hours means the alert suppression will be active outside the defined business hours. Setting a duration will have no effect if business hours are referenced.

You can create a global alert suppression (= affecting all existing and future System Profiles and Incident rules) by leaving System Profiles and Incident rules unspecified.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

404.description: Not Found: System Profile or Incident Rule could not be found

delete.description: Deletes an existing alert suppression (incident downtime).

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

head.description: Tells the DSS status plus the version, the number of mapping files, disk space available and used and disk quota (if any).

204.description: DSS info in header

storage-file-count.description: Number of files in symbol file storage

head.description: The dss-* header items tell whether the ProGuard libraries or the Symbol File Manager are configured and the DSS is enabled / running.

204.description: DSS status in header

get.description: List all iOS symbol extract files and ProGuard mapping files.

200.description: List of symbol files in response body

get.summary: List symbol files per operating system
get.description: List all symbol extract files (iOS) or ProGuard mapping files (Android).

200.description: List of symbol files in response body

get.description: List all symbol extract files (iOS) or ProGuard mapping files (Android) for a specific application.

200.description: List of symbol files in response body

delete.description: Delete all symbol extract files (iOS) or ProGuard mapping files (Android) for a specific application with a version older than the specified version.

parameters.name: versionsOlderThan
parameters.description: Only delete files with version older than this

200.description: Deletion result in response body

get.description: List all symbol extract files (iOS) or ProGuard mapping files (Android) for a specific application with a specific version.

200.description: List of symbol files in response body

put.description:
Upload a mapping file for a specific application with a specific version via multi-part form upload. Files with ending ".zip" or ".jar" are assumed to be in PKZip format, all other files in plain text.

Alternatively, you can send the file as an octet-stream in the request body. Be sure to specify the content-type of "application/zip" if the content is in PKZip format.

200.description: Upload result in response body

400.description: Bad Request: Some request parameters are not correct.

delete.description: Delete all symbol extract files (iOS) or ProGuard mapping files (Android) for a specific application with a specific version.

200.description: Deletion result in response body

put.description:
Upload a symbol extract file via multi-part form upload for a specific application with a specific version, UUID and build time, where the UUID must be in the form of "architecture.uuid", e.g. "arm64.020a290c987237f6a7d5dbb08d11ed5d".

Alternatively, you can send the file as an octet-stream in the request body. Be sure to specify the content-type of "application/zip" if the content is in PKZip format.

200.description: Upload result in response body

400.description: Bad Request: Some request parameters are not correct.

post.description:
Create an deployment event for a System Profile. The request must contain the event as JSON representation. If the request does not contain a start and end date, the current server time will be used. The default severity is 'informational' and the default state is 'Created'. 
Events with a severity of 'informational' are automatically set to state 'Confirmed'. You can set such events to other states with a subsequent update. 
It is possible to specify the start date and leave the end date unset, the end date can then be provided later with an update. 
At least the JSON properties 'systemprofile' and 'message' have to be specified.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

404.description: Not Found: System Profile could not be found

get.description: Get the JSON representation of a deployment event.

200.description: Deployment event representation in response body

put.description: Several attributes of a deployment event can be modified by updating it. You can either retrieve the event record via the GET call first and then send the modified JSON object, or you could make a partial update by providing only the properties that should get updated.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

delete.description: Permanently delete a deployment event record.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

200.description: System Profile meta data in response body

200.description: List of Agent Groups in response body

200.description: Agent Group representation in response body

put.description: Create an Agent Group by sending a JSON representation as the request body. If an Agent Group with the given name already exists, it will be updated with the information contained in the request body. Agent Group configuration can be copied from a System Profile template only for creation of the Agent Group, not on update.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

If an Agent Mapping with the given alias already exists, it will be updated with the information contained in the request body. Update requests are never interpreted as partial updates, i.e. leaving optional properties unspecified in an update request will result in a reset of these properties.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.summary: Download the full JavaScript agent in a single file
get.description: Use the full JavaScript agent if your application uses a single application.js file that contains the minified contents of all your JavaScript files, or if you are building a Mobile Hybrid app. For best compatibility ensure to place it as the first script that gets loaded. Make sure to properly configure the application specific settings like monitor signal URL and CORS support in the UEM configuration.

200.description: OK: The request has succeeded

get.description: Use this script tag to manually inject the JavaScript agent into your web application. Depending on your settings, the actual JavaScript agent file will be loaded either synchronously or asynchronously. Make sure to properly configure the application specific settings like agent location, monitor signal URL and CORS support in the UEM configuration.

200.description: OK: The request has succeeded

get.summary: Activation status of System Profile configuration
get.description: Retrieve the activation state of a System Profile configuration.

200.description: Activation status of the System Profile configuration in response body

put.description: Change the activation state of a System Profile. Activating a configuration automatically sets all other configurations to DISABLED. Manually setting the activation state to DISABLED via this call is not allowed.

get.description: Get a list of configured monitors for this System Profile.

200.description: List of monitors in response body

get.description: Get the JSON representation of the monitor definition.

200.description: List of monitors in response body

put.description: Update the configuration of a monitor or create a new monitor of the specified type. Creation of a new monitor requires the type to be specified. Properties left unspecified will be assigned the default value of the specified type upon creation of the monitor. Only specified properties will be updated, the monitor type cannot be updated once the monitor has been created. An empty string can be used for the schedule to change the monitor to run only when manually triggered.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

delete.description: Permanently delete a monitor definition.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.description: Get a list of configured hosts of this monitor.

200.description: List of hosts in response body

post.description: Add a new host expression to the monitor. If more than one subexpression is defined, a host has to match all subexpressions in order to match the host expression. If no host configured in the infrastructure config matches the host expression, the expression will have no effect on the monitor.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

delete.description: Clear all host configurations of this monitor.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.description: Retrieve the current execution status of the monitor.

200.description: Monitor execution status in response body

put.description: Set the status to RUNNING in order to trigger a monitor execution. Other status changes are not allowed with this call.

post.description: Start session recording for a specific System Profile. Starting session recording is only possible for pre-production licenses.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

get.description: Check if the live session is currently being recorded.

200.description: Recording status in response body

put.description: Set recording status to false in order to stop session recording and create a reference to the stored session. This call does not complete until all recorded data is fully processed on the Server. Depending on the environment, it can take a few minutes until an HTTP response message is received. Stopping session recording is only possible for pre-production licenses.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response. In case the session was being recorded before this call, the URI of the stored session is present in the Location header.

post.description: Store all time series and PurePaths in the Server's memory to a stored session. To limit the data to be stored, specify a start time and end time in the request body, otherwise the last 30 minutes will be stored.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

get.description: Retrieve the activation state of a System Profile.

200.description: Activation status of the System Profile in response body

put.description: Change the activation state of a System Profile.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

Properties left unspecified will be assigned the default value of the specified type upon creation of the task. Only specified properties will be updated, the task type cannot be updated once the task has been created. An empty string can be used for the schedule to change the task to run only when manually triggered.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

delete.description: Permanently delete a task definition.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

put.description: Set the status to RUNNING in order to trigger a task execution. Other status changes are not allowed with this call.

get.summary: List test runs by System Profile
get.description: Get a list of registered test runs for given System Profile that have test executions. The level of detail can be controlled with the 'extend' query parameter.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Start time (ISO 8601) - default is 1st of January 1970 00:00

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: End time (ISO 8601) - default is current time

parameters.name: lastNTestruns
parameters.description: Max number of the most recent test runs to include

parameters.name: lastNBuilds
parameters.description: Max number of the most recent builds (versionBuild) values to include

parameters.name: extend
parameters.description:
Level of detail returned in the response:
- 'runs': only meta data,
- 'results': meta data and individual test results,
- 'measures': meta data, test results and measure values

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter by category (unit, uidriven, performance, webapi)

200.description: Test runs for the given System Profile id found, list returned in the response body

post.description:
Register a test run with provided parameters. The reply contains all test run's details including the UUID.

- **category** is limited to one of the following values: 'unit' (default), 'uidriven', 'performance', 'webapi' or 'external'.
- **marker** is a label used in the Test Automation dashlet charts.
- if the **platform** is left blank, the agent will detect it automatically.
- if the **includedMetrics** is provided, only test results for these metrics will be collected in this test run. In order to collect all test results for a given metric group you can pass just the group name or leave the metric name blank.
- **additionalMetaData** can be used to provide additional data stored in Test Run, like Jenkins build ID, list of commiters, etc. Example Value:

```
"additionalMetaData": [{
 "key1": "value1",
 "key2": "value2"
}]
```

201.description: Test run registered for the given System Profile

post.summary: Search and filter test runs by System Profile
post.description: Returns a list of registered test runs for a given System Profile that have test executions. You can control the time range of included data with 'timeframestart', 'timeframeend', 'lastntestruns' and 'lastnbuilds' filter properties. The level of detail can be controlled with the 'extend' filter property.

200.description: Test runs for the given System Profile id found, list returned in the response body

get.description: Get all test run details including test executions.

200.description: Test run with the given id found, details returned in the response body

post.description: Post a test result for a registered test run of category 'external'.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

post.description: Returns all test run details (including test executions) of a finished test run.

200.description: Test run with given id found, details returned in the response body

post.description:
Sets the test run state to INVALIDATED either for all test executions within that test run, or only executions of tests that matches 'testId' (which can be package, or class or a single test).
Returns all test run details (including test executions) of an invalidated test run.

200.description: Test run with the given id found, details returned in the response body

post.summary: Set test execution's state to FAILED
post.description:
Test execution is located using testRunId (UUID) and full test name (including package and class).
Returns all details of a test run which is bound with marked test execution.

parameters.name: testId
parameters.description: Full test name including package description and class name (if applicable)

200.description: Test run with the given id found, details returned in the response body

post.description: Post a request containing a JSON body to create a PureLytics job. The location header of the response contains a reference to the created job.

202.description: Accepted: The request has succeeded and will continue in background. See Location header for progress information.

404.description: Not Found: System Profile or stored session not found

get.summary: Get information for PureLytics Stream job
get.description: Get the state of a PureLytics job with a UUID.

parameters.name: jobid
parameters.description: UUID of the PureLytics Stream job

200.description: Job progress information in response body

200.description: License information in response body

post.description: Send a license file to the AppMon Server and trigger a license import.

400.description: Bad Request: Problems with the uploaded file

400.description: Bad Request: Problems with the uploaded file

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

post.description: Restart the server. You must have permissions to shut down and restart the server.

200.description: Status of operation in response body

post.description: Shutdown the server. You must have permissions to shut down and restart the server.

200.description: Status of operation in response body

get.description:
REST interface to download and stream Support Archives (also called SysInfo Packages). The compressed bytes are streamed directly to the REST Client instead of creating a complete file on the server, providing a faster response.

Supported File Types

File type | Description | Default included
--- | --- | ---
logfiles | Log files | yes
configfiles | Configuration files | yes
dashboards | Dashboards | yes
profiles | System Profiles | yes
agentrecords | Agent records | yes
sessions | All stored sessions, including the self-monitoring session | no
interactionlogs | Interaction logs | yes
debugfiles | Debug files | yes
protocoldump | Protocol dumps | yes
licensefile | License (activation) file | yes
sensorrecords | Sensor records | yes
componentproperties | Component properties | yes
serversession | The self-monitoring session | yes
agentusagelogs | Agent usage log files | yes

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Timeout, in seconds, for fetching large files

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of file types to be included (see Implementation Notes for supported file types)

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of file types to be excluded (see Implementation Notes for supported file types)

200.description: OK: The request has succeeded

get.summary: Request the version of the AppMon Server
get.description: Get the version of the running server.

200.description: Server version in response body

get.description: Get a list of all stored sessions which are available to the current user.

200.description: List of stored sessions in response body

post.description: Upload and import a session via a form. Alternatively, you can send the file as an octet-stream in the post body.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The stored session file to upload

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: List of labels for the imported session

parameters.name: locked
parameters.description: true to activate deletion lock, false to deactivate it

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

delete.description: Delete every stored session that matches a specified session type and is older than a specified number of minutes. Additionally the deletion request can be restricted to stored sessions of a specific System Profile.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of sessions which shall be deleted

parameters.name: olderthanminutes
parameters.description: The minimum age in minutes a stored session must have to be deleted. The value 0 will delete stored sessions regardless of their age

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: If specified, the deletion will only affect stored sessions of this System Profile. Otherwise the System Profile will be irrelevant for deletion

200.description: See response body for the success of the individual deletion operations

get.description: Export a stored session. For large stored sessions the size of the downloaded file can be huge. Make sure the download machine has enough free space to ensure that the download is successful.

parameters.name: removeconfidentialstrings
parameters.description: true to remove confidential strings from the exported session, false to keep them included

200.description: OK: The request has succeeded

delete.description: Delete a stored session.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.description: Get comprehensive details of a stored session. For more information look at the response entity.

200.description: Stored session metadata in response body

get.description: Get a list of all configured user groups.

200.description: List of user groups in response body

get.description: Get the JSON representation of a user group configuration.

200.description: User group configuration in response body

put.description: Update the configuration of a user group or create a new user group.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.summary: List dashboard permissions of user group
get.description: Get a list of all dashboard permissions of this user group.

200.description: List of dashboard permissions in response body

post.summary: Add dashboard permission to user group
post.description: Add a dashboard permission configuration to this user group.

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

delete.description: Remove all dashboard permissions for this user group. If the query parameter 'dashboard' is specified, only permissions for the specified dashboard will be removed.

parameters.name: dashboard
parameters.description: Dashboard name. If specified, the deletion will only affect mappings for this dashboard.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.summary: List System Profile permissions of user group

200.description: List of System Profile role mappings in response body

post.summary: Add System Profile permission to user group
post.description: Add a System Profile role mapping to this user group to grant users of this group permissions on the specified System Profile.

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

delete.summary: Clear System Profile permissions of user group
delete.description: Remove all System Profile role mappings for this user group. If the query parameter 'profile' is specified, only mappings for the specified System Profile will be removed.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: System Profile id. If specified, the deletion will only affect mappings for this System Profile.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.description: Get the JSON representation of the current LDAP configuration.

200.description: LDAP configuration representation in response body

put.description: Replace the current LDAP configuration with the new configuration provided. LDAP authentication will be activated automatically after this REST call has been successful. When using an SSL connection and the certificate from the LDAP server is unknown, the configuration will not be stored. To avoid this, you can provide the MD5 fingerprint of the LDAP server's certificate you trust.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

put.description: Remove the currently trusted certificate of the LDAP server and trust the new certificate if its MD5 fingerprint matches the given hexadecimal representation.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.description: Check if LDAP authentication is enabled.

200.description: Activation status of LDAP configuration in response body

put.description: Change the activation state of the current LDAP configuration. Activation of LDAP authentication is not possible when using an SSL connection and the certificate from the LDAP server is unknown.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.description: Get a list of all available permissions.

200.description: List of permissions in response body

get.description: Get the JSON representation of a permission.

200.description: Permission description in response body

get.description: Get a list of all configured roles.

200.description: List of roles in response body

get.description: Get the JSON representation of a role configuration.

200.description: Role configuration in response body

put.description: Update the configuration of a role or create a new role.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

delete.description: Permanently delete a role.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.description: Get a list of all permissions assigned to this role.

200.description: List of permissions in response body

post.description: Assign additional permissions to the given role. All previously assigned permissions will remain valid. Assigning a permission not granted to the requesting user will lead to an error.

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

put.description: Assign permissions to the given role. All previously assigned permissions will be removed for this role. If in result of this update any permission not granted to the requesting user would be additionally assigned to the role or removed from the role, the request will fail with an error.

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

delete.description: Attempt to remove all permissions for this role. Permissions not granted to the user executing this request cannot be removed and will remain assigned to this role even if the request completes without an error.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.description: Get a list of all configured users.

200.description: List of users in response body

get.description: Get the JSON representation of a user configuration.

200.description: User configuration in response body

put.description: Update the configuration of a user or create a new user.

201.description: Created: The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created (see Location header)

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

delete.description: Permanently delete a user.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

post.description: Update the password of a user. You can only change your own password, i.e. the user ID must be identical to the user authorizing this call. Externally managed users (e.g. via LDAP) cannot change their password with this endpoint.

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

get.description: Get a list of all groups the user is member of.

200.description: List of groups in response body

post.description: Add the user to the given groups. All previous group memberships will remain valid. LDAP groups are assigned automatically and can therefore not be added manually.

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

put.description: Assign the user to the given groups. All previous non-LDAP group memberships will be cleared. LDAP groups are assigned automatically and can therefore not be added/removed.

204.description: No Content: The update request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

delete.description: Remove the user from all non-LDAP groups the user is currently a member of. LDAP groups are assigned automatically and can therefore not be removed.

204.description: No Content: The request has succeeded but does not have an entity-body in the response

Violation.description: Measure threshold violation contributing to an alert

sessionname.description: User-readable presentable name for the session to be stored

description.description: Description for the session to be stored

appendtimestamp.description: true to append timestamp information to recorded session name, otherwise false (default is false)

locksession.description: true to lock session, otherwise false (default is false)

labels.description: Descriptive text to mark the stored session

timeframestart.description: Start time of the interval during which the data will be stored, in ISO 8601 compatible date/time of format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

timeframeend.description: End time of the interval during which the data will be stored, in ISO 8601 compatible date/time of format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

start.description: ISO 8601 compatible date/time of format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX, seconds and milliseconds will be ignored

endby.description: End of the scheduling period, will be ignored for non-repeating downtimes. ISO 8601 compatible date/time of format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX, seconds and milliseconds will be ignored.

cron.description: Scheduling expression for Quartz cron trigger

once.description: True if the Alert Suppression is only scheduled once. If true, the cron expression will be ignored. If false, a cron expression has to be provided.

systemprofiles.description: System Profiles and Incident rules the Alert Suppression relates to

schedule.description: Human readable version of the cron expression.

begin.description: Begin of the exclusion period, in ISO 8601 compatible date/time of format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

end.description: End of the exclusion period, in ISO 8601 compatible date/time of format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

startTime.description: Test run start time in ISO 8601 compatible date/time of format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

dss-op.description: The kind of operation the response relates to

generichttp.description: Specification of the generic http target (mutually exclusive with other targets)

timespan.description: Timespan of valid business hours on the included weekdays

weekdays.description: Weekdays the specified business hours are valid on (allowed values: MON,TUE,WED,THU,FRI,SAT,SUN)

recording.description: Status of recording, true if recording is ongoing

once.description: True if the Alert Suppression is only scheduled once. If true, the cron expression will be ignored. If false, a cron expression has to be provided.

href.description: Base URL of the REST resource. Further information can be retrieved from this URL or its subresources

session.description: The name of the stored session or system profile the job runs on

status.description: The current status of the job

start.description: The start time of the job in ISO8601 format

duration.description: The job duration in milliseconds up to now

progress.description: The progress of the job in percent up to now

buildtime.description: Timestamp of build (only relevant for iOS)

uuid.description: UUID of build (only relevant for iOS)

uploading.description: true if file is still being uploaded

alias.description: Alias of the Agent Mapping (unique within Agent Group)

agentnamepattern.description: Case-insensitive pattern for the name of the Agent

agentnamematchtype.description: Matching type of the Agent name pattern

hostnamepattern.description: Case-insensitive pattern for the host name of the Agent

hostnamematchtype.description: Matching type of the host name pattern

sessionid.description: ID of the system profile or stored session to be exported from

timeframestart.description: A start date and time for the data that should be exported in ISO 8601 format

timeframeend.description: An end date and time for the data that should be exported in ISO 8601 format

exporttype.description: The type of data that should be exported

target.description: Specification of the target to be streamed to

systemprofile.description: System Profile to grant permissions for, can be either an existing System Profile id, or '*' (matches all System Profiles), or '<user id>' (matches the personal System Profile of the respective user)

role.description: The role whose permissions should be granted for the specified System Profile

start.description: Start time in ISO 8601 compatible date/time of format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

end.description: End time in ISO 8601 compatible date/time of format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

currentpassword.description: Current login password that should be changed

newpassword.description: New login password that should be applied

managementrole.description: Id of role whose permissions for server management should be granted to members of this group, default is Guest

ldapgroup.description: true if this user group corresponds to a group in LDAP

permissions.description: List of permissions assigned to this role

startTime.description: Start time of timeframe filter in ISO 8601 compatible date/time of format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

endTime.description: End time of timeframe filter in ISO 8601 compatible date/time of format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

extend.description:
Level of detail returned in the response:
- 'runs': only meta data,
- 'results': meta data and individual test results,
- 'measures': meta data, test results and measure values

status.description:
Filter test results by status.
Only relevant if response includes individual test results ('extend' set to 'results' or 'measures').
Possible values: 'invalidated', 'volatile', 'degraded', 'improved', 'missing', 'passed'

lastNTestruns.description: Max number of the most recent test runs to include

lastNBuilds.description: Max number of the most recent builds (versionbuild) values to include

category.description:
Filter by test category.
Possible values: 'unit', 'uidriven', 'performance', 'webapi', 'external'

mappings.description: List of System Profile role mappings

nextvolumerenewaldate.description: Volume renewal date in ISO8601 format

validfrom.description: License valid from this date in ISO8601 format

maximaluemtransactions.description: Maximal number of UEM transactions, -1 if not supported

Measurement.description: Measurement contributing to a measure threshold violation

start.description: Start of the timerange in format HH:MM

end.description: End of the timerange in format HH:MM

ldapuser.description: true if this user corresponds to a user in LDAP

password.description: The password for basic HTTP authentication

groupmemberattribute.description: Search attribute fo the group's members
